etymologies: late 17th century: from Latin luna ‘moon’+ solar

definitions: of or concerning the combined motions or effects of the sun and moon.
shortDefinitions: of or concerning combined motions or effects of sun and moon

definitions: of or employing a calendar year divided according to the phases of the moon, but adjusted in average length to fit the length of the solar cycle.
shortDefinitions: of or employing calendar year divided according to phases of moon

definitions: of or denoting a 532-year period over which both the lunar months and the days of the week return to the same point in relation to the solar year.
shortDefinitions: of 532-year period over which both lunar months and days of week return to same point in relation to solar year
